page.title: 05 "MEYNELL LANGLEY"
page.content: Meynell Langley , the Squires home, has recently been subdivided into many flats although the Meynell family is still in residence. Likewise, the outbuildings have been converted into dwelling houses. Part of the grounds are leased to a garden centre that specialises in bedding plants, hanging baskets and potted plants for Christmas. The present owner is the son of Cpt. G.Meynell who was posthumously awarded the V.C., 50 years ago, in the Indian North West Frontier. { MEYNELL LANGLEY TREES ----------------------- From 1950 up to this day, much replanting has taken place including oak, chestnut, maple, birch, larch, ash, poplar, Christmas trees, rowan, Corsican pine, copper beech and Japanese larch.
